title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: a tragic novel set in the Roaring Twenties that explores themes of love, wealth, social status, and the disillusionment of the American Dream
A classic American novel set in the Jazz Age.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: a classic 1960 American novel set in 1930s Alabama, exploring racism, injustice, and lost innocence through the eyes of young Scout Finch
A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence.

author: George Orwell
description: a seminal dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian society, Oceania, controlled by The Party and its leader, Big Brother
A chilling depiction of totalitarianism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: a classic Regency-era novel of manners focusing on Elizabeth Bennet, a witty, spirited woman navigating societal pressures, reputation, and class in rural England
An enduring love story of wit and social commentary.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: a seminal coming-of-age story narrated by Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned 16-year-old wandering New York City for two days after being expelled from prep school
A controversial coming-of-age narrative.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: a seminal dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State (London, AD 2540) where citizens are genetically engineered, cloned, and socially conditioned into a rigid caste system
A future society built on pleasure and stability.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: the resilient, plain, and small orphaned protagonist of Charlotte Brontë’s 1847 novel, characterized by her intelligence, independence, and strong moral compass
A passionate tale of love and independence.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: an epic high-fantasy masterpiece detailing the quest to destroy the One Ring, a powerful artifact, to defeat the Dark Lord Sauron
An epic fantasy adventure in Middle-earth.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: follows Bilbo Baggins, a home-loving hobbit who is persuaded by the wizard Gandalf and thirteen dwarves to embark on a perilous quest
A thrilling adventure of a reluctant hero.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: a Gothic, tragic novel set on the Yorkshire moors, detailing the intense, destructive, and almost supernatural love between Catherine Earnshaw and the foundling Heathcliff
A dark and brooding tale of passion.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: follows an 11-year-old orphaned boy who discovers he is a wizard and begins his education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
A young wizard's first year at magic school.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: a classic seven-book high-fantasy series by C.S. Lewis (1950–1956) following children, often the Pevensie siblings, in magical adventures
A magical adventure through a hidden world.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: an ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer, chronicling Odysseus's 10-year, perilous journey home to Ithaca after the Trojan War
An ancient epic of adventure and heroism.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: an ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer, chronicling a few weeks during the tenth and final year of the Trojan War
The story of the Trojan War.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: an exceptionally large, legendary white sperm whale in Herman Melville's 1851 novel, characterized by a snow-white wrinkled forehead, a pyramidical hump, a deformed jaw, and numerous embedded harpoons
A captain's obsessive quest for a white whale.

title: Jane Austen's Emma
author: Jane Austen
description: follows Emma Woodhouse, a handsome, clever, and rich 20-year-old in Regency England who is spoiled, headstrong, and misguidedly fond of matchmaking
A witty tale of matchmaking and self-discovery.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: a foundational psychological novel tracking Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished former student in St. Petersburg who murders an elderly pawnbroker to test a theory that superior individuals can transcend moral law
A tormented man's struggle with guilt.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: a monumental literary masterpiece detailing the lives of five aristocratic Russian families—chiefly the Bezukhovs, Bolkonskys, and Rostovs—during the Napoleonic Wars and the 1812 French invasion of Russia
An epic exploration of Russian history.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: a monumental Russian realist novel detailing the tragic, forbidden affair between Anna, a married aristocrat, and the wealthy Count Vronsky
A tragic love story in imperial Russia.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: a Gothic philosophical novel about a beautiful young man who trades his soul for eternal youth
A portrait grows old while its subject remains forever young.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: a tall, elderly, and aristocratic Transylvanian nobleman with an extremely pale complexion, a long white mustache, pointed ears, and sharp teeth
A chilling vampire tale told through letters.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: the modern Prometheus, scientist Victor Frankenstein, who creates a sentient but hideous creature from corpses
A scientist creates a tragic monster.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: a classic French adventure novel by Alexandre Dumas, detailing the journey of Edmond Dantès, a sailor falsely imprisoned in the Château d'If for 14 years
A tale of revenge and redemption.

title: The Three Musketeers
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: a classic 17th-century adventure novel following young d'Artagnan, who travels to Paris to join the King's elite guard
Friends and adventure in seventeenth-century France.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: a 19th-century historical novel by Victor Hugo following Jean Valjean, an ex-convict seeking redemption after 19 years of prison for stealing bread
A sweeping tale of justice and redemption.

title: The Hunchback of Notre-Dame
author: Victor Hugo
description: a seminal Gothic/Romantic novel by Victor Hugo set in 15th-century Paris, focusing on Quasimodo, a deformed, deaf bell-ringer of Notre Dame Cathedral
A gothic tale of love and prejudice.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: a 50-year-old, gaunt Spanish nobleman from La Mancha who loses his sanity from reading too many chivalric romances
A delusional knight's comic adventures.

title: Robinson Crusoe
author: Daniel Defoe
description: an adventurous, resourceful, and deeply religious English mariner who spends 28 years shipwrecked on a deserted island near South America
A castaway's survival tale.

title: Gulliver's Travels
author: Jonathan Swift
description: a four-part satirical travelogue narrated by ship surgeon Lemuel Gulliver
A satirical adventure across fantastical lands.

title: The Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: a classic bildungsroman following the life of Pip, an orphan blacksmiths apprentice in 19th-century England
A young man's journey toward his ambitions.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: a historical novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution, focusing on themes of sacrifice, resurrection, and social injustice
Love and sacrifice during the French Revolution.

title: The Pickwick Papers
author: Charles Dickens
description: a episodic, humorous masterpiece that follows Samuel Pickwick and his club members—Tupman, Winkle, and Snodgrass—on journeys across the English countryside
Comic adventures of the Pickwick Club.

title: Oliver Twist
author: Charles Dickens
description: a virtuous, innocent orphan navigating the harsh poverty and criminal underworld of 19th-century London
An orphan's struggle in Victorian England.

title: David Copperfield
author: Charles Dickens
description: a resilient, kind-hearted, and observant character who transforms from an abused, impoverished orphan into a successful author
A boy's coming-of-age in Victorian society.

title: Bleak House
author: Charles Dickens
description: a seminal Victorian novel and scathing satire of the British Chancery court system, highlighting how a, long-running, corrupt legal case (Jarndyce and Jarndyce) destroys lives
A complex mystery entangled with the law.

title: Tess of the d'Urbervilles
author: Thomas Hardy
description: a prominent English novelist and poet of the Victorian era
A tale of social injustice and tragic love.

title: Far from the Madding Crowd
author: Thomas Hardy
description: a Thomas Hardy novel set in rural Victorian Wessex, focusing on the independent, impulsive farmer Bathsheba Everdene and her romantic entanglements with three distinct men
A woman navigates love in rural England.

title: The Mayor of Casterbridge
author: Thomas Hardy
description: a tragic Victorian novel following Michael Henchard, a hay-trusser who drunkenly sells his wife and daughter
A man's downfall after a reckless decision.

title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
author: Anne Brontë
description: a groundbreaking Victorian novel that shocked readers with its candid, realistic portrayal of a woman fleeing an abusive, alcoholic husband
A woman's bold escape from a terrible marriage.

title: The Woman in White
author: Wilkie Collins
description: a seminal Victorian sensation novel blending mystery, romance, and suspense
A gripping tale of mystery and identity.

title: The Moonstone
author: Wilkie Collins
description: a seminal Victorian detective novel focusing on the theft of a cursed, sacred yellow diamond stolen from an Indian temple
A precious diamond theft and its investigation.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: a historical, romantic novel by Nathaniel Hawthorne set in 17th-century Puritan Boston, Massachusetts (1642–1649)
Guilt and shame in Puritan New England.

title: The House of the Seven Gables
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: a Gothic novel set in a gloomy, decaying 17th-century New England mansion in Salem, Massachusetts, that is plagued by a familial curse
A cursed house and its troubled inhabitants.

title: The American
author: Henry James
description: a realist novel of manners and melodrama following Christopher Newman, a naive but good-hearted self-made American millionaire searching for a wife in1860s Paris
An American businessman in Europe.

title: The Portrait of a Lady
author: Henry James
description: the story of a spirited young American woman, Isabel Archer, who, affronting her destiny, finds it overwhelming
A young woman's quest for independence.

title: The Turn of the Screw
author: Henry James
description: a renowned Gothic horror novella centered on a young governess hired to care for two children, Miles and Flora, at a remote estate called Bly
A psychological ghost story of ambiguity.

title: The Awakening
author: Kate Chopin
description: a landmark early feminist novel set in late-19th-century Louisiana
A woman's rebellion against societal expectations.

title: The Great Gatsby Special Edition
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Deluxe edition with annotations and illustrations.

title: Sherlock Holmes: Complete Collection
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: gathers all four novels and 56 short stories featuring the iconic detective, typically spanning 1887-1917
All Sherlock Holmes stories in one volume.

title: Wuthering Heights Special Edition
author: Emily Brontë
description: embossed, foiled covers, sprayed edges, ribbon bookmarks, and high-quality paper, often featuring an unabridged text
Beautiful hardcover with dustjacket.
